intro: Canthium megacarpum, commonly known as the giant seedpod or African hogweed, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its large, showy flowers and distinctive, elongated, fleshy fruits. Native to tropical Africa, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant's leaves are typically large, opposite, and have a rough, hairy texture. Its seeds are enclosed in a thick, woody capsule that splits open to release the seeds when mature.
